intro: Ricotia aegyptiaca, commonly known as Egyptian ricotia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of North Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly hairy surface. Ricotia aegyptiaca is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
